titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Garden Club of Allegheny County Records, 1913-2012 AIS.2006.07
titlestmt.author: Alesha Shumar, Jennifer Nicol, and Wendy Pflug.
titlestmt.sponsor: Funding for this project was made available by the Garden Club of Allegheny County and the University of Pittsburgh Library System.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 09:25:35 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Garden Club of Allegheny County Records
did.abstract: This collection documents the functions and activities undertaken by the Garden Club of Allegheny County (GCAC), a chapter of the Garden Club of America. The material, dating between 1913-2012, includes organizational records such as board and membership meeting minutes, official club reports, publications, events, correspondence, and club ephemera.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Garden Club of Allegheny County (GCAC) was founded in 1914 by a group of civic-minded women interested in the benefits of public and private gardening. The GCAC is committed to its mission of promoting knowledge of horticulture, interest in conservation and historic preservation, environmental education and civic planning and planting programs throughout Allegheny County. The club's preamble to the first meeting states its mission is "...to promote an interest in gardens, their design and management; to cooperate with the protection of wild flowers and native plants; and to encourage civic planting." During both World Wars, the group became active in the war effort by promoting Victory Gardens, aligning with the Women's Land Army, and contributing heavily to the American Red Cross War fund.

The GCAC joined the Garden Club of America (GCA) in 1916 to become more involved with the national gardening community. The GCAC has since hosted GCA annual meetings in Pittsburgh, Pa. The GCAC's civic duties have expanded from the retention of natural beauty in urban areas to developing landscape restoration projects and protecting natural landscapes. However, the GCAC has never relinquished its commitment to civic planting and has contributed gardens to several Pittsburgh neighborhoods.

The GCAC maintains a long standing tradition with Phipps Conservatory and Botanical Gardens, a botanical garden center located in the Oakland neighborhood of Pittsburgh. The GCAC often uses Phipps Conservatory as a venue for its many flower shows. Other notable projects are the 1951 establishment of a master plan and formal rose garden in Mellon Park, along with the 1961 restoration of the kitchen garden at Old Economy Village. The GCAC shows its continued dedication to education, preservation, and the restoration of Pittsburgh gardens.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Garden Club of Allegheny County (GCAC) has maintained records throughout most of their history which spans from 1913 to the present. Each series contains a scope note detailing the content found within the records. The GCAC is a chapter of the Garden Club of America and this affiliation is documented within the content of the collection. The GCAC collection contains official minutes, reports, publications, photographs, and newspaper clippings.

In March 2011, GCAC donated additional materials relating to the organization. Included were board meeting minutes, committee reports, photographs of members at various events, and many additional files on the Pizzazz event. Likewise in 2013, additional material arrived and was subsequently processed. In both cases these additions are noted as new series at the end of the collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into eight series:
Series VI. Ephemera and Media Material, 1914-2007

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Membership lists, rosters and directories of the Garden Club of Allegheny County dating from 1946 to the present are not available to researchers. The following boxes or folders are therefore restricted: Box 17 > Folders 3, 6-9, 11-13 and 16; Box 45 > Folders 11-15, 17-18 and 20-23; Box 46 > All folders.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Additional material was acquired in April 2008, March 2011 and August 2012. Further accruals are expected.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of the Garden Club of Allegheny County on April 11, 2006.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Garden Club of Allegheny County Records, 1913-2012, AIS.2006.07, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Garden Club of Allegheny County Records, 1913-2012, AIS.2006.07, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh
Records of the Garden Club of Allegheny County, 1913-2005, AIS 200607, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Alesha Shumar and Jennifer Nicol in the spring of 2006. An addition was processed by Ms. Shumar in the spring of 2010. A subsequent addition was processed by Wendy Pflug in spring 2011. The 2012-2013 additions were processed by Justin Mitchell in spring of 2013.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains the official board of director's minutes, regular meeting minutes, general meeting notes and Zone V meeting notes and information. Meeting minutes include descriptions and meeting dates, times, locations, hostesses, speakers, and agendas. This series is divided into four subseries: Regular Membership Meeting Minutes, Board of Directors Meeting Minutes, General Meeting Records and Reports and Zone V Meeting Material. The material in this series date from 1914 to 2007.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The earlier membership meeting minutes were kept in binders with each meeting numbered and in chronological order from the first meeting at the residence of President Mrs. Frances H. Denny, Springfield Farm, in Sewickley Heights on October 30, 1914. The minutes are set up with official minutes interspersed with ephemeral objects such as programs, invitations, and pamphlets which are glued between the pages of typed minutes. The later membership meeting minutes are stapled together and are also interspersed with ephemeral object. All minutes are typed and signed by the respective club secretary of that time and provide insight into the overall management and activities of the garden club.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Board of Directors meeting minutes document the proceedings of Board of Directors private meetings. They are mainly typed, but the earliest are hand written. The Board of Directors meeting minutes typically cover two to three issues per meeting and usually focus on budgetary items, future speakers and activities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The General Meeting records and reports are a culmination of annual meetings, directories, newspaper clippings, flower show announcements, and invitations. These reports directly relate to the General Meeting Records. The reports also reflect amendments and changes in the meeting and policy books. The meeting book, along with the policy book (found under Constitution and By-laws), contain general procedures for conducting meetings and were consulted during general meetings to confirm any questions concerning by-laws and voting procedures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Zone V meeting material contains notes, information and material about the regional meetings. Also included is information about Zone V's Presidents Council meetings.

did.unittitle: From Private Spaces to Public Places

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains annual official meeting reports, treasurer's reports, and committee reports. This series also includes material for reports on horticulture and conservation education. This series is divided into five subseries: Annual Meeting Reports, Treasurer's Reports, Membership Reports, Committee Reports and President's Reports.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Annual reports are prepared for the annual meeting of both GCA and GCAC. The information in the reports provides a recap and review of that year's meetings, activities, member announcements, and special events. Included in the records are funding issues, dues, and a year-end activity report.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Treasurer's Reports include meeting minutes, budget proposals and financial information. The reports show the financial activities and status of the GCAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: These files pertain to the selection of members, the standards that members should uphold and general information about present members.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries documents various committee and their activities and reports. Not all committees are represented here; many of the committee reports were included in Regular Meeting Minutes, Annual Reports and the General Meeting Material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: President's minutes are overviews of activities and general meetings as collected by the president of the GCAC. The minutes are mainly typed, but the earliest are hand written. Also included are the personal papers and notebooks of two former Presidents.

did.unittitle: Photo of Low, Dudley, Gilmore and Abel

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains material related to projects and events held by the GCAC. Several files in this series contain visual material, including photographs from the 1961 Old Economy Kitchen Garden Restoration Project and a VHS tape documenting the GCA trip to Japan that same year. Included in this series are announcements for and invitations to GCAC flowers shows, annual meeting programs, awards and certificates and information about a wide variety of garden, conservation and horticultural projects. This series is divided into five subseries: Flower and Garden Shows, Awards and Certificates, Activities and Events, Conservation and Horticulture. The material in this subseries dates from 1914 to 2009.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of announcements, invitations and programs for flower and garden shows that were sponsored by the GCAC or the Sewickley Horticultural Society, which is affiliated with the GCAC. The main attractions at flower show are the exhibits, which range in size from garden displays with elaborate landscaping to individual and club entries of prize horticultural specimens. At each show, an official theme provides the inspiration for exhibits. The exhibits are submitted for judging by category, some of which are highly competitive. Included in the subseries are several judging guidebooks that judges at GCAC events used. The GCAC also held smaller flower shows such as the annual Chrysanthemum Exhibitions and Spring Flower Shows in Pittsburgh. Announcements of these annual competitions are included in this subseries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains documents that relate to awards issued to both individual members as well as the entire GCAC. Some files document the nominations, selective process, and criteria determined by the GCAC for awards given by the GCA. Other materials simply describe the nature and the nominating process for awards and flower shows.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries documents some of the activities and events that were sponsored, attended, or developed by GCAC. These include civic activities, garden planting plans, conservation activities and educational materials. Also contained in this subseries is the Master Plan for Mellon Park, Phipps Outdoor Garden Project, Pizzazz, and Northside Project. This series also documents the GCAC's restoration of the Old Economy kitchen garden and the 1961 GCA's trip to Japan. Several members of the GCAC took part in this trip, and the items in this subseries document the gardens the club visited and events they attended while in Japan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The files in this sub-series document the efforts of the GCAC to promote and encourage conservation through various community projects. It also contains information about conservation and environmental awareness.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The horticulture sub-series includes notes and minutes of the Horticulture Committee. It also contains information about events organized by the committee and various other horticultural activities

did.unittitle: Horticultural Society of Western Pennsylvania Grants
Invasive Exotic Plants in the Mid-Atlantic

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of internal and external publications of the GCAC. These are material printed for, by, and about the GCAC. They include membership directories, by-laws, membership directories and other self-published material. This series is divided into five subseries: Membership Directories, Constitution and By-Laws, History, Bulletins and Newsletters. The material in this series dates from 1914 to 2009.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The subseries consists of the directories and membership lists of the GCAC. All of the directories are from the years of 1914 through 2006 and note positions held by members. The directories also provide a copy of the GCAC's constitution, by-laws, a schedule of the year's meetings, and a list of the club's members and their addresses.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The subseries consists of the GCAC's Constitution and By-laws, as well as the by-laws of several other garden clubs. The by-laws included in this subseries come from the GCAC, the GCA, the Pittsburgh Garden Club, and the Sewickley Council of Garden Clubs. The Sewickley Council of Garden Clubs oversees the activities of the diverse garden clubs in the Pittsburgh area. The Pittsburgh Garden Club is another club that is closely affiliated with GCAC and their activities. The GCA by-laws are presented in a small self-published book that also contains various officer and committee reports, a club calendar, and a membership list. Also included is the policy book which was consulted during general meetings to confirm any questions concerning by-laws and voting procedures.

did.unittitle: Sewickley Council of Garden Clubs By-laws

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of items that document the history of the GCAC, some of which were produced by the GCA. Such materials provide a context within which the more specific history of the GCAC can be placed. These materials describe projects, record awards, and provide facts about the organization.

did.unittitle: Fifty Blooming Years:1913-1963 by Marjorie Gibbon Battles and Catherine Colt Dicky
Fiftieth Anniversary Review of Activities Pamphlet
GCAC History of Projects and Gifts
Chronological List of Major GCAC Events
The Past Twenty-five Years GCAC History

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The bulletins in this subseries were published by the GCA and mainly focus on GCA current projects, meetings, and upcoming flower shows.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes club newsletters published by GCAC and feature official GCAC invitations, updates, projects, and events related to the club. Newsletters from other organizations are also included here.

did.unittitle: Newsletters about Birds from Other Organizations
Newsletters about Gardens from Other Organizations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains letters of appreciation from the annual meeting of 1948, letters about activities. The majority of letters include thank you notes and appreciation memos. Other letters include official club activities correspondence and a group of letters received by former GCAC president Mrs. Richardson. The material in this series dates from 1920 to 2006.

Correspondence Received by Mrs. Frank E. Richardson

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series is composed of photographs, newspaper clippings, awards and VHS tapes collected by the GCAC. The clippings and photo directly relate to GCAC flower shows, garden exhibits and other GCAC activities. There are also several plaques and ribbons won or given out by the GCAC. There are also ten VHS tapes of the WQED Step One Conference. This series is divided into three subseries. Subseries one is Ephemera Material, subseries two is Step One Conference Media and subseries three is Newspaper Clippings and Scrapbooks. The material in this series dates from 1914 to 2005.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains objects collected and used by the GCAC. There are several medals and ribbons as well as three official GCAC rubber stamps and an ink pad.

did.unittitle: Official GCAC stamps and stamp pad

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the WQED video of the Step One Conference on environmental issue.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries houses oversized materials, newspaper clippings about GCAC flower shows and photographs of gardens and garden exhibits. The newspaper clippings, all from local Pittsburgh newspapers, contain articles about various events and activities of the GCAC and the GCA. The articles collected feature topics on gardens around Pittsburgh and the Pittsburgh Horticultural and Botanical Societies. Three double-sided scrapbook pages feature items from the GCA's 1961 trip to Hawaii and Japan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The records found in this series represent additions to the collection made by the Garden Club of Allegheny County from 2009-2011. Records types represented in this series are: meeting minutes, committee reports, officer reports, event and activities planning documents, awards and award applications, correspondence, and newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series represents additions made to the collection by the Garden Club of Allegheny County in 2012 and 2013. It includes meeting minutes, bylaws, photographs, membership information, activity and event documentation, awards, and officer reports.
